entry.title: SAP User Experience in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Every successful business knows that an exceptional user experience is the crown jewel of their operations. Not only does it enhance efficiency and productivity, but it also fosters customer satisfaction, ultimately leading to sustained growth and success in the competitive market. 

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release introduces a range of innovative enhancements, tailored to refine user interactions and optimize business processes with the help of artificial intelligence. Let's dive into these user experience highlights that will make your business shine. 

TLDR? Check out this video made by my digital twin to get an overview of my highlights:

 


Joule for business 

Speaking of jewels, SAP‚Äôs very own AI co-pilot, Joule, introduces advanced intelligent assistance to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, allowing business users to engage with their systems using natural language for quicker and more impactful results. By integrating artificial intelligence within the system, Joule serves as a digital assistant, revolutionizing the way users navigate and utilize business applications. It eliminates technical obstacles by understanding user intent and providing contextually relevant outcomes through intuitive, conversational interactions. 


Joule for consultants 

Joule for consultants is specifically designed to speed up project delivery by offering instant access to a unique, expertly curated SAP knowledge base. This includes over 200,000 pages of documentation and content from SAP communities, helping consultants find answers quickly and saving up to 1.5 hours daily. It also features SAP-specific code intelligence, reducing code interpretation time by up to 40%. Overall, Joule can accelerate project timelines by up to 14%, cutting a typical 12-to-18-month project by 1.5 to 2.5 months. 

 

Joule for developers 

Joule for developers is integrated within the ABAP development tools to enhance productivity by aiding in faster code writing, testing, and delivery for ABAP Cloud. For environments like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, it reduces development time and effort, speeding up value realization. Key features include predictive code completion, a chat feature for natural language queries, code explanation, and support for generating and improving ABAP unit tests and test classes for CDS entities, ensuring reliable applications. 

Design updates for SAP Business Suite consistency 

Navigation has become more seamless than ever with a newly designed navigation menu that removes the extra click previously needed to reach My Home. Users can now effortlessly access their favorite apps and folders from anywhere within the platform, enhancing efficiency. Additionally, personalization through "All Spaces" further improves ease of use. The introduction of the new shell bar maximizes vertical space while prominently displaying the product name. This update needs to be activated using "/UI2/SHELL_BAR_TOGGLE." Please note that adjustments may be necessary for automated testing. The user menu has been overhauled for greater intuitiveness, featuring larger images, improved spacing, and an easily accessible sign-out button. Notifications have also been refined for better management, allowing users to sort by date or importance with clear categories such as "Today" and "Yesterday." Finally, visual enhancements in Search and Error handling bring a modern touch to the interface, providing users with a smoother and more guided experience. 

Recap feature on My Home 

Moving on to user-centric improvements, the Recap feature is all set to transform how business users stay updated with their My Home enhancements. With a focus on saving time, this intelligent feature highlights the changes since the user‚Äôs last login by comparing current data with the past 24 hours. It brings tasks needing attention right to the forefront, streamlining decision-making and increasing productivity by allowing users more time for strategic work. 

Manage News app on My Home 

Meanwhile, the Manage News app strikes at the heart of timely communication. It centralizes internal messages and key updates by enabling the creation and dissemination of news articles directly on My Home. Here, administrators can control visibility, categorization, and the targeted audience of news content, facilitating consistent and streamlined communication across teams. This leads to greater connectivity and informed decision-making within the workforce. 

 AI-assisted UX features

In my last blog post, I introduced some of our AI-assisted UX features, which aim to enhance user interactions by making them more intuitive and efficient through AI-driven capabilities. With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, these AI-assisted UX features are now generally available! We structure them in base features and premium features: 

  • Base features:
    1. AI-assisted enterprise search (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Users can access business data efficiently via natural language queries, enhancing productivity and user experience. Enabling this search feature allows employees to dig through data with queries such as ‚ÄúShow me sales orders in overall status in process" or "Show me open sales orders that have a net value greater than 100 EUR‚Äù, offering seamless data discovery.


       
    2. AI-assisted easy filter (available through limited promotion in 2502 release): This feature elevates your user experience by allowing filters through natural language, reducing time spent on manual input. Users can enjoy intuitive interactions and explore complex filters with criteria such as currency or date range all supported by generative AI. Access to recent and favorite queries further optimizes user interactions. 


    3. AI-assisted smart summarization (also available through limited promotion in 2502 release): It simplifies data presentation through rich text summaries of object pages. This allows for better business data understanding and efficient sharing across productivity platforms, ensuring smooth collaboration between co-workers and customers. 

       

Kick start your AI journey as an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customer or partner by using the base AI-assisted features at no additional costs. The only required action from your side is the acceptance of SAP AI terms for base AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (by one S-user of your company). Afterwards, we will reach out to you with a confirmation of the activation and send over the required, minimal, ‚Äúlast mile configuration‚Äù on your side. 

  • Premium features:
    1. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for insights cards (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Personalizing your My Home receives a smart upgrade through generative AI, adding insights cards directly with a mere click. It supports various SAP Fiori applications, offering previews for data consistency ensuring quality. 

       

And, as we cannot get enough of our AI-assisted UX, we have some more features waiting for you in beta testing in this release as well! 

  • AI-assisted smart solutions for situations on My Home: This feature enhances task efficiency by intelligently adapting the interface for rapid situation resolution. Leveraging AI-driven insights directly from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition homepage, users gain easy access to essential information and actionable steps. This innovation fosters a seamless user experience, reducing the time and effort required for decision-making.

      
  • AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications: You can leverage AI to efficiently incorporate applications through natural language instructions. It allows users to preview and select AI-recommended applications swiftly, significantly enhancing the setup process. This feature is particularly useful for new users, making their interaction with the platform smoother and more intuitive.


  • AI-assisted easy fill: This innovation revolutionizes form completion by using natural language input to automatically map text to appropriate fields, minimizing navigation time and errors. This results in improved accuracy and efficiency in data entry, as users can maintain focus and streamline processes without tedious form-checking. 


  • AI-assisted error explanation: This feature aids in understanding and solving errors within SAP Fiori applications by delivering AI-generated resolution suggestions embedded within the error messages. This facilitates quicker problem-solving and enhances user understanding, particularly for newer users needing guidance on error resolution. 

Our beta testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition offers early access to new features and innovations, allowing users to experience enhancements firsthand and give feedback to shape the final product. Participants play a key role in influencing development to ensure it meet practical business needs, creating a collaborative link between developers and users for continuous improvement. Want to be part of this journey? Sign up for the beta testing here: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/3910  

Collaborative ERP: To-Dos in Microsoft Teams 

Speaking of collaboration, the To-Dos functionality within Microsoft Teams gives users the ability to receive notifications of new tasks directly within their activity feed, enhancing responsiveness and efficiency. This integration facilitates seamless approval processes, allowing end-users to act on situations swiftly, whether it be within Microsoft Teams or directly through SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This aims to streamline workflows, support decision-making based on real-time data, and improve team connectivity by centralizing task management within familiar interfaces.

These enhancements in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 are designed not only to transform but also to ignite the user experience, bringing an elegant polish to the platform that goes beyond traditional bounds. 

Find out more about SAP User Experience in this blog series by Thomas Reiss. 

Want to learn more about Artificial Intelligence? Check out these blog posts by Yannick Peterschmitt and Sang Dao. Refer to this document for more information.

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 6: SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur
entry.content:
This sixth post in my series gives an overview of user experience innovations in SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur. For SAP Customer Experience, look at the new AI agents and the capability to build custom agents, plus AI innovations for marketeers in SAP Emarsys, and Joule and AI order summaries in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2.  SAP Concur takes travel planning to the next level with the whole new travel experience, complemented by the new Joule Booking Agent enabling users to use natural language to book a trip.

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

 

SAP Customer Experience

The user experience highlights I have picked are all AI-related:

  • AI Agents.
  • SAP Emarsys UX innovations.
  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 UX innovations.

This news article summarizes what‚Äôs new overall for SAP Customer Experience, beyond UX-related innovations:

  • Connected for Growth: What‚Äôs New with SAP Customer Experience in Q2 2025.

AI Agents

As I explained in part 1 of this series, AI agents work in the background to give a greatly enhanced user experience. A number of powerful AI agents are available for SAP Customer Experience, via the package Joule Premium for Customer Experience. This blog post and video give a nice overview of three of them in action:

  • AI Agents in Action.
  • Video: See How AI Agents Streamline Customer Service (3:11 min.)

The latest UX innovations are:

  • Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant.
  • Digital Service Agent (via Early Adopter Care program).
  • Ability to create custom agents in the CX AI Toolkit.

AI Shopping Agent for the SAP Commerce Cloud Shopping Assistant

The shopping agent helps customers when visiting an online shop: they can simply use natural language to state what they are looking for, and the shopping agent will respond with suitable suggestions. Figure 1 shows an example, where the user starts out by stating that they are looking for shoes to wear for two mile long walks while wearing a suit. Two shoes are suggested, and the user asks which one is comfortable right away, since he doesn‚Äôt want a long break in period. The agent recommends one model, and the customer then asks for a recommendation for a belt to match, which the agent promptly gives him.

Figure 1: Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant from SAP Commerce Cloud. Alt Text: three screenshots of a tall and narrow screen showing a chat, one for each of the interactions explained in the main text. Each response shows one or two images: in the first case two shoes, then one shoe and then one men‚Äôs belt.

Find out more here, and watch the video embedded there to see it in action:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Shopping Agent

Digital Service Agent

The new digital service agent helps to provide your customers with a great user experience, similar to how the shopping agent is aimed primarily at your customers. It enables customers to ask questions with natural language and provides answers based on your company‚Äôs business knowledge residing in the SAP system. Hence, it is able to resolve common inquiries and issues, giving customers a good experience. Furthermore, by freeing up you sales and service team to focus on more complex inquiries, your customers will also receive a better service and hence better experience.

The digital serice agent is currently only available for select customers via the Early Adopter Care program. Figure 2 in the next section shows how these customers can select it in the AI Agent Builder.

Find out more here:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Digital Service Agent.

Create Custom Agents with CX AI Toolkit

You can now create your own custom agents with the CX AI toolkit. Figure 2 shows the start screen for the AI Agent Builder, where you can select ‚ÄúCustom Tool‚Äù to start the wizard which takes you through the steps to create a custom agent.

Figure 2: The AI Agent Builder in the CX AI Tookit for creating custom AI agents or using SAP templates to create AI agents. Alt Text: A screenshot with ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs Create AI Agents‚Äù in large text in the middle below an illustration, below in much smaller text ‚ÄúStart by selecting an Agent Template‚Äù. Below that, two rows of three cards representing Agent Templates are shown: Custom Tool, Knowledge Agent, Classification Agent, Digital Service Agent, Q/A Agent, and Shopping Assistant Agent.

Find out more here:

  • Documentation: Create a Custom AI Agent.

Further Information on AI Agents for SAP Customer Experience

For a deeper understanding of the power of these AI agents, have a look at this longer video:

  • Video: SAP CX AI Toolkit: AI Insights Agents for SAP C4C & Shopping Assistant | Product Inspiration Series (32:21 min.)

SAP Emarsys

AI-Assisted Report Builder using Natural Language

You can now easily create a report using natural language to describe what you are interested in. Figure 3 shows an example of the entry screen. At the bottom you see hints on what kind of queries you can enter.

Figure 3: AI-assisted report builder in SAP Emarsys. Alt Text: A screenshot with ‚ÄúUnlock the Power of Data with the AI-assisted Report Builder‚Äù in the middle. At the top a text entry field containing the query ‚ÄúWhat are the Sent, Delivered, Bounced, Opened, Clicked, Purchased, Unsubscribed, Complained for my Email campaigns in the past month?‚Äù, to the right an AI button ‚ÄúGenerate Report‚Äù. At the bottom of the screen two example queries are listed.

Once you have created the report, you can easily adjust it using a set of convenient filters, such as the date range as well as the list of campaigns and metrics. Watch this video to see it in action:

  • Video: AI-assisted Report Builder (46 seconds).

AI-assisted Product Finder using Natural Language (Pilot)

Pilot customers can now try out the new AI-assisted product finder, which allows users to search for product to add to marketing campaigns using natural language. Figure 4 shows an example of how to enter your search text, see more here:

  • Video: AI-assisted Product Finder (38 seconds).

Figure 4: AI-assisted product finder available to SAP Emarsys pilot customers. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a screen with a left half containing the Product Finder, with a search field containing ‚ÄúMost popular shoes in the last 6 month‚Äù, above an empty space with the text ‚ÄúWelcome to Product Finder!‚Äù in the middle. The right half shows an image of someone dancing in the sun and an image of a dress, along with some describing text.

Read more about latest SAP Emarsys innovations here:

  • SAP Emarsys Q2 2025 Product Release.
  • SAP Emarsys introduces new generative AI capabilities in June Product Release

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2

Joule in SAP Sales Cloud

Joule is now available in SAP Sale Cloud Verion 2, helping users get quick insights, for example about an account. As you can see in Figure 5, these insights can be charts as well as text based.

Figure 5: Joule for SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot of Joule showing Customer Account Overview, with the text ‚ÄúShow Key Metrics‚Äù entered as chat, below which a card with a vertical stacked bar chart shows credit limit usage (remaining amount and exposure amount), below that a card showing Key Metrics (Activity) and part of a donut chart for Tasks, Phone Calls, Appointments, Visits etc.

Have a deeper look here:

  • Video: Intelligent Selling with Joule in SAP Sales Cloud & SAP S/4HANA Cloud | Product Inspiration Series (16:04 min.)

Sales Order Summary

The Sales Order Summary uses generative AI to summarize key information about the sales order, as well as including information about some changes, for example how the price compares to the original price. Figure 6 shows an example, with the insights shown on the left of the screen.

Figure 6: Sales Order Summary in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a sales order, with the left third showing an overview with AI-generated insights such as ‚Äú13 days past requested date‚Äù, ‚ÄúOverall discount is EUR 808.55‚Äù. On the right, the Order Summary tab is shown, with account name, net and gross value, pricing stats, above ‚ÄúProducts in Cart (2)‚Äù showing a list of two products, followed by the top part of a list of pricing steps.

Learn more here:

  • Documentation: Sales Order Summary.

 

SAP Concur

The new Concur Travel experience makes it much easier to book travel involving multiple bookings, such as a flight plus hotel plus rental car. And if you just need to book one item, you can do that very easily now with the new Booking Agent powered by Joule.

New Concur Travel Experience

When travelling for a few days, one often needs to book more than one item. A typical combination is booking a flight, a hotel and a rental car. Up until now, you have had to book each item separately and take care that the dates and time match. Now, with the new Concur Travel experience, planning and booking is much easier: you can enter the start and end dates for your flight, and the new feature Match Flight Booking is applied to the hotel and car, so that dates and time match automatically.

Figures 7 to 11 show what this looks like: Figure 7 shows the start screen, where you select which items you want to include (flight, hotel, car, train). Figure 8 shows the flight view, where flight dates have been entered. Figure 9 shows the hotel search, with the default selection ‚ÄúBased on flight selection‚Äù, and similarly Figure 10 shows the rental car search, with pick-up and return times calculated based on the flight schedule. Figure 11 shows the finalize screen, in this case showing that the flight and hotel has been selected but the rental car is still open.

Figure 7: New Concur Travel experience start screen. Alt Text: A screenshot of a pop-over with a large image of a magnifying glass on a globe, above the text ‚ÄúStart Planning‚Äù. Below that four check boxes in a row: Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train, at the bottom ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel‚Äù buttons.

Figure 8: New Concur Travel experience screen with flight details. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a trip planning for a Trip to Las Vegas. The left third of the screen shows a list with items Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, with Flight selected. Below the list buttons ‚ÄúAdd to trip‚Äù and ‚ÄúSearch‚Äù. On the right a selector for round-trip (selected), one-way or multi-city, with fields for from / to locations and a date field for the stard and end date. To the right a button ‚ÄúTime preferences‚Äù and a drop-down for selecting ‚ÄúCabin‚Äù.

Figure 9: New Concur Travel experience screen with hotel details. Alt Text: As for Figure 8, but with Hotel selected, and on the right Hotel Search displayed, with the fields for ‚ÄúHotel, location, or name‚Äù and ‚ÄúDates‚Äù filled with the text ‚ÄúBased on flight selection‚Äù.

 Figure 10: New Concur Travel experience screen with rental car details. Alt Text: As for Figure 9, but with Rental Car selected, and on the right Rental Car Search displayed, with the fields for ‚ÄúPickup‚Äù and ‚ÄúDates‚Äù filled with the text ‚ÄúBased on flight selection‚Äù and the field ‚ÄúDrop-off‚Äù filled with ‚ÄúSame as pickup‚Äù. Pickup Time and Drop-off Time fields have 10:00 AM entered.

Figure 11: New Concur Travel experience finalize screen. Alt Text: Screenshot showing ‚ÄúTrip to Las Vegas‚Äù on the left two-thirds, with a card summarizing the flight with United Airlines from San Antonio, TX (SAT) ‚Äì Las Vegas, NV (LAS) and a card summarizing the hotel Courtyard by Marriott Las Vegas. The right third shows the Estimated Total Cost $2497.85 above a list with the cost of each item (flight, hotel, rental car), and buttons for ‚ÄúFinalize Trip‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel Trip‚Äù, and options to book anything else (Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train).

As you can see in Figure 11, another advantage of the new experience is that you get budget transparency at the trip level. Also, you have flexibility to book parts of the travel now and other parts later.

Technically it supports deep linking, which means that you can send a trip-level link to colleagues which includes all the trip parts, making it easy to coordinate trip planning when travelling with others.

To find out more, have a look at the

  • Documentation: Trip Planning in New Concur Travel.

Booking Agent in Concur Travel

The new Booking Agent lets you use natural language to book business travel which is compliant with company policy and budget constraints as well as taking into account your personal travel preferences.

Figure 12 shows an example where the user has simply stated ‚ÄúI want to book a flight from San Francisco to London on Sept 9th and back on Sept 13th‚Äù. The answer shown takes into account the user‚Äôs frequent traveler memberships, flight availability and company policies.

Figure 12: New Concur Travel Booking Agent in Joule. Alt Text: A screenshot of Concur Travel with Joule opened on the right, the content is explained in the main text, with the possible flights listed alongside a thumbnail image representing the airline ‚ÄújetBlue‚Äù.

Watch it in action and find out more:

  • Video: Concur Travel ‚Äì Booking Agent demo (2:33 min.)
  • SAP Discovery Center: Booking Agent.

 

Continue Reading - UX Innovations in UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile

I hope you enjoyed this sixth part, covering SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur, with great new AI-powered user experiences helping users work more efficiently and effectively.

Here is the link to the final part seven, covering latest innovations in UI design and technology for web and mobile:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 7: UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile.

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

entry.title: No More Guesswork: Joule‚Äôs Help Content Makes SAP Fieldglass Easy to Use

Whether you're creating job postings or navigating other tasks, Joule delivers smart, contextual guidance. It‚Äôs like having a support expert built right in.

Use Case: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going out on vacation‚Äîhow do I assign a proxy?‚Äù

This is a common need in SAP Fieldglass ensuring continuity for tasks while away.  Instead of digging through manuals users can ask Joule:

‚ÄúI‚Äôm going out on vacation‚Äîhow do I assign a proxy?‚Äù

Joule delivers the relevant help documentation from the SAP Help Portal, complete with step-by-step instructions. This access to help content empowers users to self-serve confidently‚Äîboosting adoption and user experience.

With Joule, SAP Fieldglass becomes intuitive, responsive, and user-friendly.

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 7: UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile
entry.content:
This seventh and last post in my series gives an overview innovations in our UI tools and technologies, making it ever easier to design, build and integrate UIs, for both web and mobile applications. For designing apps, web and mobile, we have a new SAP Design System portal and UI Kits in Figma. For developers, we have added further AI assistance, as well as many individual improvements, including support for the latest international accessibility standard WCAG 2.2. Fun fact: SAPUI5 is now used on all 7 continents ‚Äì yes, Antarctica too! 

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

The above post also gives an update on building your own Joule agents, so I will not cover that here, but rather focus on web and mobile UI development.

 

Design News

SAP Design System Portal and UI Kits in Figma

We recently introduced the new SAP Design System portal that brings together the product design guidelines SAP Fiori for web, SAP Fiori for iOS, and SAP Fiori for Android, as well as to the new digital design system guidelines. With its enhanced usability, simplified versioning and improved performance, designers (and developers!) get a better user experience compared with the previous SAP Fiori design guidelines.

Figure 1: The SAP Design System portal start page. Alt Text: Image with header saying ‚ÄúSAP Design System‚Äù, with a ‚ÄúSee what‚Äôs new‚Äù button below it, and then four subsections in a horizontal row: SAP Fiori for Web, SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for iOS and SAP‚Äôs Digitial Design System. A ‚ÄúFeedback‚Äù button is on the bottom right.

The new UI Kits available for designers in Figma make it easy for designers to design accessible UIs at enterprise scale, for web applications, mobile iOS and Android applications as well as wearables. The UI Kits provide reusable components for web and mobile, along with web floorplans, which give you what you need out-of-the-box.

Figure 2: SAP‚Äôs UI Kits for Designers in Figma. Alt-Text: The image shows two rows of four cards representing UI Kits: SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for Web, Designing for Performance, SAP Fiori for iOS, SAP Fiori for watchOS, SAP Fiori for Wear OS, SAP S/4HANA for Web, and Accessibility Design Tools. On the very left of the image information about SAP is listed, with links to resources such as www.sap.com/design-system.

Find out more here:

  • New SAP Design System Portal for SAP Fiori Design Guidelines, and New UI Kits for Designers.

Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite

Consistency of the user experience across the various applications used by a user is an important part of overall usability, helping users to feel confident and at ease when using a suite of products ‚Äì no unexpected surprises. We have identified areas directly relevant to users and plan to introduce a number of design updates in SAP Fiori for web across our suite of products to further increase consistency.

The areas we have redesigned and which we plan to provide across our suite of products this year and next year are:

  • Shell bar (at the top of the user‚Äôs screen)
  • Navigation menu: side navigation (see Figure 3 below).
  • User menu
  • Notifications
  • Search in the shell bar

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition already supports the first four of these, you can have a look at them in part 2 of this series, in the section SAP Fiori Launchpad and Design Updates for Suite Consistency:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 2: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori Launchpad.

As outlined in Part 1, SAP Build Work Zone standard edition also supports side navigation.

Find out more about these design updates here:

  • Upcoming Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite (SAP Fiori for Web).

We also provide designers with a refreshed new set of illustrations, to be used for illustrated messages. Figure 3 shows some examples.

Figure 3: Examples of new illustrations. Alt Text: On the left top three different size illustrations showing an ice cream cone fallen on the ground; bottom left an illustration of a globe with a magnifying glass, representing ‚Äúsearch‚Äù. On the right an image of a list report showing the search illustration since no data has been selected.

 

News for Creating Web UIs

Extensibility made easy with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

Extending SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is made much easier since we introduced the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard. The latest update introduces the ability to create an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension.

Figure 4: Creating an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension. Alt Text: Screenshot showing step 1 ‚ÄúExtension‚Äù task where users can select from a row of four cards ‚ÄúCustom Field‚Äù, ‚ÄúCustom Logic‚Äù, ‚ÄúCustom Process‚Äù and ‚ÄúUser Interface Extension‚Äù. The latter has a subtext ‚ÄúAdapt the current application or extend it visually with a new application‚Äù. The latter two cards have a link ‚ÄúManage SAP Build Projects‚Äù at the bottom. The bottom right shows two buttons ‚ÄúNext‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel‚Äù.

Learn more here:

  • SAP Build Extensibility Wizard for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • Simplify SAPUI5 Code Extensions with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

Auto-fix of coding errors with UI5 linter

UI5 linter is the tool of choice to check your UI5 project for using best practices and replacement of deprecated SAPUI5 APIs. With UI5 linter v1.12.0, we are happy to announce the initial version of an autofix feature: Use the "--fix" argument to let UI5 linter apply fixes to your code automatically. Read more about it here:

  • Migrate your code with UI5 linter ‚Äì Autofix has landed.

Legacy-free version of SAPUI5 available via cloud access

Once you have removed code which uses deprecated SAPUI5 APIs, you can try out the legacy-free version of SAPUI5 in the cloud, which has all deprecated code removed. Discover the benefits and how to try it out in this blog post:

  • Explore SAPUI5/OpenUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free.

Accessibility taken to the next level: WCAG 2.2 support

Accessibility is key to using SAP's business solutions. Adopting the latest standards gives applications a true cutting edge, ensuring that solutions are inclusive and meet the diverse needs of users globally. When creating apps with SAP Build and SAPUI5, developers can leverage the latest Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2.

For example, two of the key new requirements in the 2.2 version are:

  • The minimum target size of an interactive element now needs to be 24x24 px, so that users don‚Äôt accidentally activate a neighbouring element.
  • Each operation that can be performed by dragging can also be performed alternatively without dragging ‚Äì so that people who cannot use a mouse to drag can still use the UI.

See more details:

  • SAPUI5 is Leading the Way in Accessibility with WCAG 2.2

SAP Fiori tools ‚Äì open source, faster app creation, more AI

One of the most powerful recent innovations is the AI-powered project accelerator from SAP Fiori tools, which allows you to create a fully functional app with database tables, CDS-Views, OData service and a Fiori element list report UI based on a sketch of what you want. I introduced this in my Q1 update post from March. This can now be started from Joule in SAP Build Code. Also, it has been further enhanced, and is also available as open source, so that our developer community can make contributions themselves. Find out more here:

Enhancements for SAP Fiori Elements with OData V4

We are continuously enhancing SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements. I have picked two enhancements to highlight here for developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4, which are covered in the following subsections:

  • Support for inline edit for object pages.
  • Support for the analytical table on the object page.

Support for inline edit for object pages

You can now develop object pages where users can directly edit fields within facets, without having to first press the ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù button and go into edit mode. Figure 5 shows an example from a test application.

Figure 5: Inline editing of fields in an object page with SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Alt Text: A screenshot of part of an object page ‚ÄúTravel‚Äù, which is overall in display mode, but the field ‚ÄúStarting Date‚Äù has been selected and is editable, with a new entry made, and ‚ÄúSave‚Äù and ‚ÄúCancel‚Äù icons next to the field.

Support for the analytical table on the object page

For applications where users need to be able to analyze the data in a table, for example grouping data and aggregating data, developers should use the analytical table rather than the responsive table.

These tables are often used for the ‚Äúlist‚Äù part of an SAP Fiori elements list report, which consists of a list and an object page for the details. Now, developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4 can include an analytical table into one of the facets of an object page. Figure 6 shows an example.

Alt Text: A screenshot of an object page with a facet ‚ÄúJournal Entries (4)‚Äù which contains an analytical table, where the entries are grouped by ‚ÄúCase Journal Entry‚Äù. One of the groups is expanded, showing two lines. Below them the sum of the debit column is shown for the expanded group, and below that for the entire table.

entry.title: Dashboard and Business AI Insights for SAP License Simulation and Analysis
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP has introduced the SAM4U solution, an excellent tool to gather data from SAP backend systems for the consolidation and analysis of users, engines, and HANA EE license consumption.

The Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption, available on SAP Store, provides extended analytics and simulation capabilities to view SAM4U data from new angles. It empowers customers moving to S/4HANA, S/4HANA Private Cloud, or already working under an SAP RISE contract to run different ‚Äúwhat if‚Äù scenarios based on data extracted from their SAP system, helping them find the best approach to optimize SAP license consumption.

What Was Missing?

While SAM4U provides valuable transparency, customers often asked:

  • How do I see the potential savings?

  • How do I define a strategy for optimization?

  • Where exactly should I focus my cleanup efforts?

License optimization typically falls into three categories:

  • Fast optimization: achieved quickly with user data cleanup in SAP backend

  • Obtainable optimization: achievable in reasonable time with cleanup and role/profile tuning

  • Maximal optimization: the long-term goal, achieved when roles and authorizations are precisely aligned with actual usage

What was missing was clarity and insights to navigate these paths effectively.

How it is solved

The new release of the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption brings two major updates:

  • Clarity through an extremely informative dashboard

  • Business AI insights powered by the Skybuffer AI platform, an SAP Business AI certified solution from SAP Store

The dashboard

This is the highlight. The dashboard presents clear KPIs on one page, helping to get insights into current estimated spending and estimated savings, following both fast and obtainable strategies.

 Pic. 1 The Dashboard

One of the central KPIs is License Optimization Potential, which shows the estimated current contract costs compared to optimized contract costs. The KPI highlights savings that can be achieved either through the fast users cleanup approach or the obtainable approach of cleaning up users and optimizing roles with the highest optimization potential.

 Pic. 2 License Optimization Potential

There are many other useful insights. For example, it shows how many authorization objects are not used at all. This is a target for maximal optimization and one reason it is not so easily obtainable. The lower the number, the better the authorizations are aligned with active usage.

 Pic. 3 Excess Authorization

The evaluation of maximal optimization is also visualized by the FUE Gap KPI:

 Pic. 4 FUE Gap - Authorization vs Active Usage

There is also a very helpful hint about SAP_ALL and SAP_NEW profiles still in use in production:

 Pic. 5 Users with Sensitive Authorization Profiles

The total number of roles and profiles that can be optimized and the savings this brings are also clearly summarized:

 Pic. 6 Excess Roles

The insights

Business AI insights in the dashboard bring extra clarity and understanding. For example, they show the fast optimization saving potential and provide clear explanations and strategies on how to reach it:

Pic. 7 Business AI Insights

AI recommendations are also available for obtainable or maximal optimization:

 Pic. 8 Max and Obtainable Optimization

Effectively, this functions as a personal SAP License Analysis and Optimization consultant, virtualized and trained to understand the organization‚Äôs own data.

The AI Assistant is always there, and expanding its knowledge base is straightforward through the Skybuffer AI platform. For example, it can present the top 10 roles for optimization or provide additional information related to SAP licensing:

 Pic. 9 Top 10 Roles for Optimization

Of course, all the well-established simulation and analysis tools of the Accelerator remain available. With the new release, they work even better, helping to test and simulate the AI Assistant‚Äôs recommendations.

Conclusion

The Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption now provides one of the most powerful toolsets on the market to analyze and optimize SAP users and engines licenses independently. It helps avoid the significant costs of SAP license optimization consulting and delivers deep insights into user and engine data. This comes without the need for a complex SAM4U installation and without spending time and money on consulting services that quickly become outdated.

What to do next?

Running SAP under a RISE contract? Use the dashboard and Business AI insights at least once per month to avoid FUE consumption increases and surprises. Train your team with the solution and the organization will not face unpredictable growth of SAP license consumption. Leave consulting for the exceptional case when the company grows faster than its SAP role set. üòâ

entry.title: Simulation for SAM4U Solution: Flexibility with the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption
entry.content:
When adopting SAP SAM4U, one of the biggest challenges customers face is handling role, profile, and authorization changes without disrupting production. This is where the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption brings real value, thanks to its simulation capabilities.

What Customers Expect from Authorization Simulation

With the simulation, customers get the ability to:

  • Log changes at the role or profile level on the system dataset.
  • Track and review roles and profiles that have been modified.
  • Revert changes at the role or profile level, either all at once or individually.
  • Modify user-to-role or user-to-profile assignments.
  • Perform mass unassignments of roles and profiles (e.g., removing SAP_ALL or SAP_NEW).
  • Identify and review changes made to users.
  • Revert user assignments back to their original state when needed.

 Pic. 01 Roles and Profiles Changes Tracking

 Pic. 02 Roles and Profiles Mass Unassignment

 Pic. 03 Changes to the Role Detailed Review

But that‚Äôs not all! The real power lies in managing simulation snapshots.

 Pic. 04 Snapshots of Simulations on the System‚Äôs Dataset Level

Why Simulation Snapshots Matter

Simulation snapshots are created at the system dataset level, allowing you to:

  • Save changes without applying them directly in production.
  • Create new consolidations from modified datasets.
  • Avoid repetitive, time-consuming rework when changes cannot be applied immediately.

Example: Working with Two Systems in Consolidation

Imagine you are analyzing two systems in a consolidation project. You make changes to roles and users in both systems. However, due to restrictions, you cannot yet apply changes in System A.

Without losing your work, you can:

  • Create a new consolidation using the dataset from System A and the modified snapshot from System B.
  • Or temporarily move the snapshot from System A into the dataset, and later reapply those changes when they are ready for production.

 Pic. 05 The Power of Management Snapshots and Datasets that are Used in Consolidation

This flexibility ensures you never have to redo your work and can manage changes efficiently.

Why Customers Prefer the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption

Customers appreciate the simulation feature because it provides:

  • System-level flexibility to manage changes.
  • Easy-to-handle snapshots that can be created, reviewed, reverted, and reused.
  • No duplication of effort, once a change is made, it is saved and can be reapplied.
  • Reliable validation, you can reload fresh production data and check if changes were successfully implemented.

If changes were tracked only at the consolidation level, fresh data from the system would overwrite them. This is why the Accelerator focuses on system snapshots, giving customers full control to experiment, validate, and roll back whenever needed.

 Pic.06 Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption Dashboard for Simulation Results Analysis

With the Accelerator for SAM4U Adoption, simulation becomes not just a test environment, but a strategic tool for efficient and risk-free SAM4U adoption.

entry.title: 5 Tips for Getting Started with the SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit
entry.content:
The SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit is your go-to resource for creating consistent, efficient, and accessible user interfaces. The kit helps you design faster without starting from scratch.

Here are five helpful tips to get started and design with confidence:


1. Explore the full component library first 

Before jumping into design work, begin with the design foundations separately, such as color, typography, and shadows. Understanding these basics early on will help you make better, more consistent decisions throughout your work. You‚Äôll also find SAP icons and product illustrations integrated directly into the kit. 

Once you're familiar with the foundations, take time to explore the full set of components included in the file. The UI kit provides a wide range of ready-made elements, scalable and fully aligned with SAP‚Äôs design principles, all in one place. 


‚ÄØ2. Use variables to switch between themes easily 

In the SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit, variables control core style properties such as colors, typography, and spacing. 

The kit includes support for multiple themes that reflect SAP‚Äôs visual language in different environments. The default light theme is called Morning Horizon, and for low-light settings, the Evening Horizon theme provides a dark mode alternative. 



Using variables, you can switch between these themes easily within your Figma file. This lets you preview how your designs will look across different user preferences without rebuilding components from scratch. 


3. Use the Slot for content placement 

Some components, such as Dialogs or Cards, include a Slot - a clearly marked area (highlighted in orange) where you can insert your own content, like text, icons, or buttons, while keeping the original structure and behavior intact. 

To use it, simply select the Slot layer in the component and replace it with your own content using the ‚ÄúSwap instance‚Äù option in the right-hand panel. There‚Äôs no need to detach the component, your changes will stay consistent and maintain the design integrity. 
 

 
Using the Slot keeps your designs flexible, editable, and easy to maintain. 

 

4. Keep your file organized and use naming conventions 

Maintaining a well-organized file helps you and your team navigate and manage designs efficiently. Use clear naming conventions for frames, components, and layers so it‚Äôs easy to find and update elements later. This practice saves time and reduces errors, especially as your designs grow in complexity. 
 



5. Stay in sync with releases 

The SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit is actively maintained and regularly improved with new components, updates, and refinements based on user feedback. To stay up to date, keep an eye on official announcements and communications from the SAP Design team.  You can find the latest releases and enhancements on our SAP Design System Portal ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs New‚Äù page. 

The SAP Fiori for Web UI Kit gives you more than a set of components, it provides a solid foundation for building enterprise-ready designs that scale.

entry.title: Introducing Horizon Themes and Usability Enhancements in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
A Fresh Look and a Smoother Experience for All Users

We are excited to announce the introduction of the Horizon themes in SAP Analytics Cloud a modern, cohesive visual language aligned across SAP‚Äôs product suite. You will have access to Morning and Evening Horizon, the light and dark themes as well as to the high contrast white and black themes.

This release also brings a series of improvements to the side navigation, user profile, user settings, and the search, making it easier than ever to find insights and personalize your application.

 

Horizon Themes: Modern, Accessible, and Unified

The introduction of Horizon themes marks the next step in our user experience journey. These themes feature clean lines, contemporary color palettes, and improved contrasts, resulting in visually appealing UI that remain comfortable for extended work sessions. Accessibility is at the heart of Horizon, with thoughtful color selections and focus indicators for every user. The experience remains consistent as you move between SAP Analytics Cloud and other SAP solutions, offering a unified interface that supports productivity and ease of use. Personalize your experience by choosing from light, dark, and high contrast theme variants‚Äîsimply head to your user settings to select your preferred look.

The Belize theme will remain the default in Q4 and continue to be available for the next few quarters. Looking ahead, Horizon will become the standard theme in the first half of 2026. If you‚Äôd like to enable Horizon for your organization sooner, simply navigate to the administration section under default appearance to set Horizon as your tenant‚Äôs default theme.

 

Improved User Profile and Settings

The user profile and settings have been reimagined to put key information and settings at your fingertips. Instantly access your account details, profile image, and settings in one clear and organized dialog. Additionally, the ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù section is now conveniently located within your user profile making key information more accessible whenever you need it.

 

Simplified and Adaptive Side Navigation

The redesigned side navigation bar logically organizes content and tools for easy access. Collapsible sections expand your workspace, and in collapsed view, hovering over each symbol shows module names to help you quickly find what you need.

 

More Convenient Search

The search now features autocomplete, making it noticeably more convenient and user-friendly. As you begin typing, relevant suggestions appear instantly, streamlining the process of finding models, stories, and files. This enhancement helps you locate what you need more efficiently, even if you can‚Äôt recall exact names, ensuring a smoother search experience.

These updates are based on user feedback and extensive research, reflecting SAP‚Äôs commitment to delivering an analytics platform that is powerful, accessible, and a pleasure to use. The Horizon themes and experience enhancements aim to reduce friction, promote creativity, and empower you to shape insights in a visually appealing and highly functional space.

 

What's Next

You can continue to style your SAP Analytics Cloud Stories independently, as the story theme mechanism will remain unchanged and won't follow the overall SAC theme.

With the Q1 2026 release, we plan to update the preferences for new stories and make the Horizon Morning theme available in every story; both Morning and Evening Horizon themes are currently available on GitHub.

The new Horizon themes and user experience improvements will be available mid-November in the Q4 2025 SAP Analytics Cloud release.

If you have feedback on the Horizon themes or the planned story theme updates, please reach out to me by message or in the comments.

entry.title: SAP Fiori Innovation Day in Dallas focused on the intersection of AI and UX
entry.content:
Thanks to the ASUG Dallas chapter for helping us reach new audiences with SAP Fiori Innovation Day Dallas. We had a dedicated track within the larger ASUG event in which participants could learn about the latest user experience innovations, build an SAP Fiori elements app in less than 90 minutes, and see some sneak previews of AI-powered functionality that we‚Äôre working on. They also asked our sponsors questions during a panel discussion and found many useful tips they could use back in the office.

In the keynote, ASUG CEO, Geoff Scott, made a compelling case that moving to the cloud is a prerequisite for innovation at speed. In his interactive session, he polled the audience to give people a sense of how they compare to their peers in terms of innovation and adoption of various technologies. Many companies were using AI in some capacity, and some rely on multiple AI tools.  It was interesting to see what use cases the attendees find most relevant.

ASUG found that automation and analytics are the top AI use cases.

In the UX Strategy and What‚Äôs New section, Ioannis and Ute talked about the continuing evolution of SAP Fiori, how SAP Fiori elements brings the Fiori design system to apps in SAP S/4HANA, and demoed the Fiori experience in SAP Cloud ERP. They showed new AI-powered capabilities in My Home, such as Recap and recommendations, and explained how AI built into the SAP Fiori elements framework powers easy filter, smart summarization, and error explanation. All of this functionality combines to make business users more productive by making it faster and easier to find the apps and data they need in their S/4HANA system.

We had a day full of learning and fun.

In the partner panel, experts from Mygo Consulting, Qubittron, Mindset Consulting, and cbs Corporate Business Solutions shared their expertise on:

  • How organizations measure the return on investment for UX and AI projects.
  • Where AI playing a role in UX and how agents fit into the picture.
  • The relative value of AI for business users and developers.
  • The top AI use cases that make sense for companies
  • Where to focus your efforts in the near term to gain benefits from AI

Thanks to Sujeeth, Sidhartha, Andy, and Bastian for your unique insights and actionable advice. I found it interesting that many of the topics that people mentioned would be useful in the future were already part of our ‚Äúone more thing‚Äù session at the end of the day.

The hands-on workshop focused on using AI to accelerate the process of building SAP Fiori apps. Participants used AI in three main ways:

  1. Gathering user requirements in a business requirement documents or via sketching
  2. Uploading the resulting document into SAP Fiori tools AI to generate an SAP Fiori elements app
  3. Making further updates and refinements to the application

We used SAP Fiori tools extensively. This is a logical choice since they are built into SAP Business Application Studio.

The final session of the day (and highest rated) was our lab preview / sneak peak at a few projects are currently in development. As with any discussion of future functionality, we made it clear that these demos might or might not turn into actual products. With this in mind, Sebastian and Katja showed:

  • Vibe coding using MCP servers. (Vibe coding was also part of the ASUG keynote, so this is clearly becoming a mainstream topic, at least among software developers.)
  • App Finder to make it easier to find information in your S/4HANA system.
  • Easy Fill, which speeds up data entry by extracting content from an email or other text and using it to update the relevant fields in an app built using an SAP Fiori elements object page.
  • Smart Helpers to make it easier to get your work done in SAP. I‚Äôm being deliberately vague here as we‚Äôll share more at SAP TechEd and its companion roadshows in early November 2025.

Thanks to everyone who made SAP Fiori Innovation Day a success

SAP Presenters (in order of appearance): Ioannis Grammatikakis, Ute Oemler, Sebastian Steinhauer, Katja Zoch

SAP Fiori Innovation Day sponsors: cbs Corporate Business Solutions, Mindset Consulting, Qubittron, and Mygo Consulting

ASUG events team: Nicole Kern, Kara Hughes

ASUG volunteers: Heather Davis, Simon To

Behind the scenes team: all the developers, architects, product managers and other colleagues who built the functionality and set up the demos and hands-on systems.

All the customers: we appreciate your questions, which help us understand your priorities and focus our development resources.

Next steps

  • Register for the monthly SAP Fiori development roundtable call to meet other developers and architects who build SAP Fiori apps.
  • Subscribe to the SAP Fiori development newsletter, in which we share updates on SAP Fiori elements, SAP Fiori tools, SAPUI5, and SAP Build Code every other month.

entry.title: How to unassign an Authorization Package from an S-user ID in SAP for Me
entry.content:
As an administrator managing user access in SAP for Me is a critical part of maintaining system security and operational efficiency. Whether you're onboarding new users as an admin, or adjusting access for existing ones, knowing how to properly assign and revoke authorization packages is essential. 

 

Why This Matters?

Authorization packages define what an S-user ID can access within the SAP for Me ecosystem‚Äîfrom support cases to license data, viewing systems, software download, etc. Keeping these permissions up to date ensures compliance, prevents unauthorized access, and streamlines user roles across your organization.

 

Steps:  

  1. Log in to SAP for Me using your S-user ID and password.  
  2.  In the SAP for Me homepage, click on ‚ÄúUsers & Contacts‚Äù tab under Dashboard at the left side of your screen.  
  3. Then, click on ‚ÄúManage Users & Authorization‚Äù card. Or simply go to‚ÄØUser Management.  
  4. Under the list of users, find the S-user ID to unassign the authorization package from. Or simply use the search field to search for the specific S-user ID and click on the magnifying glass to search.  
  5. Click on the user/S-user ID (not the checkbox).
  6. Click on the‚ÄØEXISTING AUTHORIZATION PACKAGES‚ÄØtab.  
  7. Click the Edit (Pencil) icon on the top right of that section. 
  8. Click on the checkbox in front of the Authorization Package(s) to be removed. 
  9. Click OK. 
  10. Click‚ÄØSave‚ÄØon the top right of the EXISTING AUTHORIZATION PACKAGES section. 

     

For more details, please refer to Knowledge Base Article: 2878696 - How to unassign an Authorization Package from an S-user ID - SAP for Me.

entry.title: SAP User Experience Update: What‚Äôs New for SAP S/4HANA 2025 (Private Cloud and On-Premise)
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA 2025 comes with a whole host of user experience innovations and improvements.  Web access via My Home and the SAP Fiori launchpad has many useful improvements, as does SAP Mobile Start for mobile access. Joule gives conversational access to Private Cloud Edition using natural language, now also with analytical insights. There are additional collaboration capabilities, and many improvements in details: some towards providing a more consistent and integrated SAP Business Suite, some simply making a user‚Äôs life easier. Finally, design and UI technology is also advancing, with powerful AI support for developers now available.

This post covers:

  • UX Updates for Consistent and Integrated Business Suite
  • Web access: My Home and SAP Fiori launchpad
  • Mobile access: SAP Mobile Start
  • Joule
  • Situation Handling news
  • AI-Assisted capabilities: outlook
  • New collaboration capabilities
  • UX improvements in details
  • UI adaptation improvements for key users
  • Design and Technology news

If you want to get an impression of how good SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, looks across all the main product areas, have a look at the online Product Tour.

Since this post covers what‚Äôs new, building on the previous 2023 release, you might want to have a look at the UX innovations which came with the Feature Pack Stacks 00, 01 and 02 of the 2023 release:

  • SAP User Experience Update: What‚Äôs New for SAP S/4HANA 2023 (Private Cloud and On-Premise).
  • User Experience Advances with SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01 (Private Cloud and On-Premise).
  • SAP User Experience Q4/2024 News for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023.

For a full overview of what‚Äôs new since the FPS00 shipment of the 2023 release, have a look at the documentation (note that it includes features from the above 2023 FPS01 and FPS02 blog posts, as well as this one):

  • What‚Äôs New for SAP Fiori launchpad for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

 

UX Updates for Consistent and Integrated Business Suite

We aim to provide a consistent and integrated experience for all users of the SAP Business Suite, which means providing an entry point for users to access all the various SAP products within the suite, and ensuring that the user experience across these products is consistent, making it easy for users to use applications from different products.

Entry Points

Figure 1 shows our approach for providing a web and a native mobile entry point to the products of the suite, such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud. I‚Äôd like to highlight that Joule can also be seen as an entry point to access the entire suite, since our goal is to provide Joule wherever you are, be it in our web applications or native mobile apps. Using Joule, our goal is to allow users to query and perform actions on all the products and applications which they are authorized to use, simply using natural language. As you‚Äôll see below, we are making good progress towards this goal.

Figure 1: Entry points providing an integrated workplace for accessing the SAP Business Suite. Alt Text: Image showing Joule on the left, ‚Äúavailable web and mobile‚Äù, and on the right a diagram with boxes indicating that SAP Mobile Start, SAP Start, and SAP Build Work Zone provide central access to SAP, with three boxes below for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SAP SuccessFactors and Other SAP Products.

Web Central Access

I have covered recent UX innovations in our web central entry points, such as SAP Start and SAP Build Work Zone, and central services such as SAP Task Center, in my recent cloud UX blog posts. Since these capabilities also apply to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition as well as SAP S/4HANA (except for SAP Start), I will not repeat them here, but rather refer you to them:

  • SAP User Experience Q1/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: Many New Innovations Available (AI, Joule and More).
  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update ‚Äì Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

 What we will look at in this post in detail are UX innovations for local access from web or mobile, via My Home and the SAP Fiori launchpad, and via SAP Mobile Start. Each has a dedicated section further below.

Design Updates for Suite Consistency

To achieve consistency across the suite, we have made design improvements which are relevant for a consistent user experience across the entire SAP Business Suite, and which are now available with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 and SAP S/4HANA 2025. As I mentioned in my April blog post Upcoming Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite (SAP Fiori for Web), consistency of the user experience across the various applications used by a user is an important part of overall usability, helping users to feel confident and at ease when using a suite of products ‚Äì no unexpected surprises.

In this section, we‚Äôll look at four design updates provided by the SAP Fiori launchpad, as well as examples of the new design for illustrations:

  • Navigation menu: Side navigation
  • Updated shell bar
  • Updated user menu
  • Updated notifications
  • New illustrations design

Navigation Menu: Side Navigation

Many SAP products already offer a navigation menu on the left of the screen, a pattern already familiar to many people. Hence, we have decided to apply that approach to navigation across the SAP Business Suite in upcoming releases.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP S/4HANA, the side navigation is displayed as an overlay, as you can see in Figure 2. It gives you direct access to your favorite apps, either directly or via the folders you have created. It also gives you direct access to your Spaces and Pages. The previously available menu to access all your spaces and pages along with personalization options is available via the entry ‚ÄúAll Spaces‚Äù at the bottom of the menu.

A big benefit of this new navigation menu is that you can now access your favorite apps directly from any application. Previously, you would have to return to My Home and then click on your favorite app, now you can access it directly from the menu, as shown in Figure 2.

Figure 2: The new navigation menu, opened up from the new shell bar, showing direct access to Favourite Apps, My Spaces and All Spaces. Alt Text: an image showing a list of sales orders and on the left a pop-over with a navigation menu with the sections already mentioned. Below the ‚ÄúFavourite App‚Äù eight apps are listed as well as two folders for favorite apps, plus the folder ‚ÄúInsights‚Äù for the insight tiles.

New Shell Bar ‚Äì need to switch it on!

The new shell bar design for the SAP Business Suite is available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. The immediately visible difference is that now the product name is displayed to the right of the SAP Logo, in this case ‚ÄúS/4HANA Cloud‚Äù as you can see at the top of Figure 2. The logo and the name are all contained within a clickable area, which brings the user to the start page (e.g. My Home).

The new shell bar enables the next two design updates to the user menu and to notifications.

By default, after upgrading, the old shell bar will be shown, with the new navigation menu. We advise that you check any test automation and RPA (Robotic Process Automation) you may have before switching on the new shell bar, since you may need to make some adjustments ‚Äì in particular if you log off at the end of a test.

You can switch on the new shell bar via the Activate New Features application, with the feature ‚Äú/UI2/SHELL_BAR_TOGGLE‚Äù.

Updated User Menu

The new user menu design shown in Figure 3 provides more space for the avatar of the user, and provides more space between items for easier selection. Data Context supported by the Extended Framework

The data context is business data from business objects involved in a situation instance that can be collected, distributed, and used for advanced analytics ‚Äì for example using the Monitor Situations ‚Äì Extended app. If enabled in a situation type, data context is collected when a situation instance is created, updated, or completed. For example, If you use the situation template Quantity Deficit in Supplier's Delivery to inform specific members in your purchasing organization about a deficit in the quantity of materials to be delivered by the supplier, you'll get, for example, the material, plant, or supplier as part of the data context.

With the 2025 release, every extended object-based situation template supports data context. You can activate it in the Manage Situation Types - Extended app. Doing so results in an event being triggered that includes the data context every time a situation instance is created, updated or completed.
